intro: Gomphostemma wallichii, commonly known as the Himalayan cissus, is a climbing vine native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically followed by elongated, fleshy fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests at high altitudes. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticulture.
